title: Ukrainian space industry players continue work, eye European projects amid war
summary: While Russia’s invasion of Ukraine continues to impact the Ukrainian space sector, senior industry representatives say that local companies have so far managed to adapt their activities to the realities of war, and they are determined to advance joint projects with their European partners.

title: Watch live: Astronauts head outside space station to prep for new solar arrays
summary: Astronauts Kayla Barron and Raja Chari floated out of the International Space Station airlock for a spacewalk Tuesday to install brackets and struts to support new solar arrays to upgrade the research lab’s power system.

title: ISS astronauts conduct spacewalk as busy period of station operations begins
summary: Two NASA astronauts have begun a spacewalk to continue the process of upgrading the space station’s power systems, kicking off a busy period of upcoming operations amid the continued uncertainty over the future of Russian co-operation on the ISS.

title: NASA ready to roll out SLS
summary: NASA is ready to roll out the first Space Launch System rocket this week for a countdown rehearsal ahead of a launch later this year.

title: Space station operations remain normal despite geopolitical tensions
summary: Russia’s invasion of Ukraine has not affected operations of the International Space Station or plans for a NASA astronaut to return home on a Soyuz spacecraft late this month, according to agency officials.

title: SpaceX preparing for third Starship ‘full stack’
summary: SpaceX appears to be preparing Starship 20 and Super Heavy Booster 4 for their third ‘full stack’ demonstration after two seemingly successful...

title: Agile supplies thrusters for Astrobotic, ispace and Masten lunar landers
summary: Agile Space Industries, a Durango, Colorado company focused on in-space chemical propulsion, is additively manufacturing thrusters for robotic lunar landers being built by Astrobotic Technology, ispace and Masten Space Systems.

title: DoD decommissions two missile-tracking satellites after 12 years in orbit
summary: The two Space Tracking and Surveillance System satellites were taken out of service on March 8. They were launched in 2009 on a United Launch Alliance Delta 2 rocket.

title: Launch of U.S. Space Force missile-warning satellite delayed indefinitely
summary: The launch of a U.S. Space Force mission known as USSF-12 has been put on indefinite pause.

title: OneWeb not eager to tear up launch contract with Arianespace
summary: OneWeb working with Arianespace, who owes the satellite internet firm six more Soyuz launches, to find a ride to orbit for more than 200 of its spacecraft left grounded by an embargo on Western payloads flying aboard Russian rockets. But with launch capacity constrained outside of China and SpaceX, a major OneWeb competitor, the commercial satellite internet provider is facing an inevitable delay in completing its constellation.
